article_text:
Withdrawing from one field to another, with the goal remaining the same, for example taking the second largest city Kharkiv would be just as good for the Russians, much like getting that southern land bridge.

Russian forces appear to be withdrawing from their failed bid to take #Kyiv . We assess that the main #Russian effort is now eastern #Ukraine . See today's control-of-terrain #maps from @TheStudyofWar and @criticalthreats . pic.twitter.com/Stqp9h4PlB

German Foreign Minister @ABaerbock : "Putin is saying every other day that he‚Äôs having, as he calls it, peace negotiations but... he‚Äôs bombing Mariupol... you can‚Äôt say on the one hand that you are having... peace negotiations and on the other hand, you are bombing hospitals.‚Äù pic.twitter.com/1hOSQz3Z5F

There is a reason why the French military intelligence chief was fired. The French map is laughable ‚Äî just look at Sumy, which is not Russian controlled or surrounded. https://t.co/l66t7KzL9y

says again Ukraine has not commented. neither have we. we know who the aggressor is,

Details are very limited at this time and are likely going to change as more information comes available, but reports indicate that a pair of Ukrainian Mi-24 Hind attack helicopters crossed low over the border into Russia early Friday morning and struck an oil storage facility in Belgorod. If these details stick, the pre-dawn strike is the riskiest direct attack on Russian interests outside Ukraine by Ukrainian forces since the war began five weeks ago ‚Äî it would also seemingly be the first strike launched by manned aircraft against Russian territory since at least the Korean War.

Early Friday morning (Ukraine local time), videos began surfacing on social media showing blacked-out Mi-24s making rocket attack runs on a large oil storage facility in Belgorod, which lies not far beyond Ukraine's northeastern border. The oil storage tanks are seen exploding and a massive fire ensuing, one that appears to be still burning at this time.

x Two Ukrainian helicopters crossed into Russian territory and fired on an oil depot in the city of Belgorod, injuring two people, a regional governor said. It is the first Ukrainian airstrike Russia has reported on its territory since the start of the war.https://t.co/ZMPpOhC3OL pic.twitter.com/XjNMQCiXmi ‚Äî The New York Times (@nytimes) April 1, 2022
